items.title: Engineering Manager, Front-end
items.description: Founded in 2012, Lumen Learning uses open educational resources (OER) to provide affordable course materials that improve learning and replace expensive textbooks in high-enrollment college courses. Over 350 institutions across the U.S. use Lumen's award-winning digital courseware for in-person, online, and blended courses.
responsibilites: Leading front-end development across our products
Providing guidelines to developers and content team for creating inclusive and accessible markup and testing with screen readers
Updating overall team hiring process and managing hiring for the front-end team
Holding 1:1s for a cohort of 5 team members at all skill levels
In direct collaboration with the Director of Engineering, establishing and modeling engineering team norms
Organizing and running team meetings, including sprint planning and retrospectives
Conducting company-wide workshop on accessibility and inclusive design principles
Collaborating with product owners and designers to successfully estimate and complete projects

items.title: Adjunct Professor
responsibilites: Instructing undergraduate students in GD 220 (Graphic Design 2) and GD 431 (Front End Web development)
Developing curriculum and assignments for each 16-week course
Working 1:1 with students and providing detailed code review in response to assignments

items.title: Senior UX Engineer
items.description: Fractured Atlas builds software and provides services to help artists and arts organizations—over 500,000—handle the business side of their work, like raising money, tracking donors and selling event tickets.
responsibilites: Led front-end development of our crowdfunding site
Managed growing UX team and serving as project lead for crowdfunding and fundraising tool
Provided coding guidelines for writing maintainable Sass and inclusive and accessible markup
Created site wireframes and prototypes to improve internal discussions and planning about site features and organization
Wrote documentation, participated in code review and organized and ran team meetings, including retrospectives
Developed and presented all-staff training on accessibility testing and best practices

items.title: Senior Front-end Developer
items.description: Detroit Trading Company aggregates in-market automotive shopper intelligence, providing data that is responsible for more than $1 billion in monthly car sales.
responsibilites: Created brand style guide and built component-based Sass stylesheets to make development more efficient
Led A-B testing of lead-generation forms to increase engagement and conversion. Lead funnel conversion increased from ~5% to more than 10% through improvements to copy, design and mobile layout.
Prepared site wireframes and prototypes to improve internal discussions and planning about site features and organization
Collaborated across the company, including CEO, .NET and Angular developers, designer and sales, to advocate for UX and to complete successful projects

Led front-end development of our brand sites (car.show and usedca.rs); for online automotive shopping tools for brands such as Time, AutoGuide, CNET and Kmart; and for data-driven dashboards for our clients
Designed mobile-friendly, responsive layouts for automotive shopping sites and lead-generation forms
Browser and device testing of all web projects to ensure the best possible experience for all users

items.title: Freelance Web Designer + Developer
items.description: Designed and coded web sites for clients, including small and mid-size businesses, nonprofits, educational institutions and individuals. Majority of projects were bespoke WordPress sites, including custom themes, custom content types and custom plugin development. Handled lead generation and client relations and education/training.

items.title: Superpowered Front-end Theming with Sass & SMACSS Workshop
Girl Develop It
items.description: Baltimore chapter leader and teacher from 2013–2017. Organized and presented hands-on workshops for women to learn web and software development. Coordinated teachers and volunteer teaching assistants across a wide variety of tech subjects. Built relationships with local companies and nonprofits who can provide space for our classes or other sponsorship opportunities. At the time I stepped down, the chapter had 1500+ members and had hosted 60+ events.

items.title: Creative Mixtape
items.description: Collaborative events between 7 Baltimore professional design associations. Participated in event and sponsorship logistics, including development of the one-page event site for our kickoff December 2016 event.

items.title: Bmore on Rails, AIGA, Mesh Baltimore
ChangeEngine
items.description: Wrote a column on the intersection of art and measurable impact from 2012–2014 (archive of articles)

items.title: Tech Mission Org of the Year (Girl Develop It Baltimore)
Von Hess Graduate Fellowship in Museum Education
PASSHE Women's Consortium Annual Undergraduate Women's Leadership Institution Scholarship
